javadoc:
Interface for address correlation algorithms that can generate an address mapping from one
 set of program addresses to another.

methods.name: correlate
methods.comment: Returns an address mapping from one function to another.

return.comment:
an AddressCorrelation that represents a mapping of the addresses from the
 source function to the destination function.

methods.name: correlate
methods.comment: Returns an address mapping from one piece of data to another.

return.comment:
an AddressCorrelation that represents a mapping of the addresses from the
 source data to the destination data.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current Option settings for this correlator.
@return the current Option settings for this correlator.
methods.name: getOptions
methods.comment: Returns the current Option settings for this correlator.

return.comment: the current Option settings for this correlator.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the options to use for this correlator.
@param options the options to use for this correlator.
methods.name: setOptions
methods.comment: Sets the options to use for this correlator.

params.name: options
params.comment: the options to use for this correlator.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the options with the default settings for this correlator.
@return the options with the default settings for this correlator.
methods.name: getDefaultOptions
methods.comment: Returns the options with the default settings for this correlator.

return.comment: the options with the default settings for this correlator.

name: AddressCorrelator
comment:
Interface for address correlation algorithms that can generate an address mapping from one
 set of program addresses to another.
